dt: {bc}the collective mental activity expressed in the complex, coordinated behavior of a colony of social insects (such as bees or ants) regarded as comparable to a single mind controlling the behavior of an individual organism

dt.t: The tiny bees in a hive are more or less unaware of their colony, but their collective {wi}hive mind{/wi} transcends their small bee minds.

dt: {bc}the collective thoughts, ideas, and opinions of a group of people (such as Internet users) regarded as functioning together as a single mind

dt.t: … Mindy Kaling asks her Twitter followers for the best dinner spots in cities she's visiting. Generally, people trust that feedback from the {wi}hive mind{/wi} is correct and well-informed.
While the building was being renovated, Jackson and his wife turned the design of the studio kitchen over to the {wi}hive mind{/wi} of the staff.

… It's just not rational to believe that people are able to read, let alone understand, all the privacy policies …. Instead, users now rely on the Internet {wi}hivemind{/wi} to know if a particularly egregious privacy change is afoot.

shortdef: the collective mental activity expressed in the complex, coordinated behavior of a colony of social insects (such as bees or ants) regarded as comparable to a single mind controlling the behavior of an individual organism
the collective thoughts, ideas, and opinions of a group of people (such as Internet users) regarded as functioning together as a single mind
